title: Beyond the bomb: When adversaries bring their own virtual machine for persistence
summary: The article discusses a sophisticated cyberattack technique where adversaries deploy their own virtual machines (VMs) within a target's network to maintain persistence. This method allows attackers to operate in a controlled environment, bypassing traditional security measures and evading detection. The use of VMs provides the attackers with a flexible platform to execute malicious activities, such as data exfiltration and lateral movement, without leaving noticeable traces. title: Trump gives Nvidia green light to sell advanced AI chips to China
summary: Former President Donald Trump has reportedly given approval for Nvidia, a leading technology company, to sell its advanced artificial intelligence (AI) chips to China. The move is seen as an effort to balance competitive interests while maintaining checks on the strategic transfer of technology. title: FACTS Benchmark Suite: Systematically evaluating the factuality of large language models
summary: The article presents the FACTS Benchmark Suite, a comprehensive tool designed to systematically evaluate the factual accuracy of large language models (LLMs). title: Why Isn’t Online Age Verification Just Like Showing Your ID In Person?
summary: Online age verification differs from in-person ID checks due to the complexities of digital identity and privacy concerns. Unlike physical interactions where a person simply shows an ID, online systems must ensure users are of appropriate age without compromising sensitive personal information. The challenge lies in creating secure and reliable verification methods that protect users’ data while effectively restricting age-restricted content. title: Fortinet FortiGate Under Active Attack Through SAML SSO Authentication Bypass
summary: The article discusses a significant cybersecurity threat targeting Fortinet's FortiGate devices, which are under active attack due to a vulnerability in their SAML SSO (Security Assertion Markup Language Single Sign-On) authentication process. This flaw allows attackers to bypass authentication measures, potentially gaining unauthorized access to sensitive systems and data. The vulnerability underscores the importance of immediate attention and remediation by affected users to secure their systems against exploitations.
